intro: Chelonanthus schomburgkii, commonly known as the Schomburgk's chelonanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less commonly cultivated species.
